headline: Stocks to Watch Recap: Fair Isaac, Tesla, Stellantis, Netflix
summary: ↗️ Fair Isaac (FICO): The credit-analytics company said it would license its scores used for assessing mortgage borrowers' creditworthiness, allowing resellers to bypass credit bureaus. Fair Isaac stock jumped 18%.

headline: FICO Shakes Up Credit-Score Market
summary: FICO is upending the credit-scoring industry by giving mortgage lenders a way to offer its FICO credit score without dealing with Experian, Equifax or TransUnion.

content.title: FICO Shakes Up Credit-Score Market
content.summary: FICO is upending the credit-scoring industry by giving mortgage lenders a way to offer its FICO credit score without dealing with Experian, Equifax or TransUnion.

headline: S&P 500 Gains & Losses Today: Buffett's Berkshire Buys; Fair Isaac Soars, Equifax Falls
summary: Major U.S. equities indexes ticked higher Thursday. Outperformance from materials and technology stocks offset declines in most sectors as investors continued to weigh the implications of a government shutdown.

content.title: S&P 500 Gains & Losses Today: Buffett's Berkshire Buys; Fair Isaac Soars, Equifax Falls
content.summary: Major U.S. equities indexes ticked higher Thursday. Outperformance from materials and technology stocks offset declines in most sectors as investors continued to weigh the implications of a government shutdown.

thumbnail.caption: Johannes Eisele / AFP via Getty Images Berkshire Hathaway, led by Warren Buffett, is making its biggest acquisition in years.

headline: FICO to Directly License Credit Scores to Mortgage Resellers
summary: Through a new program, mortgage resellers will be able to calculate and distribute credit scores directly to customers, reducing their reliance on credit bureaus.  This will bring more price transparency and savings for mortgage lenders, mortgage brokers and other industry participants, FICO said in a statement.  Shares of credit-reporting bureaus TransUnion and Equifax Inc. each fell more than 8% on Thursday.

content.title: FICO to Directly License Credit Scores to Mortgage Resellers
content.summary: Through a new program, mortgage resellers will be able to calculate and distribute credit scores directly to customers, reducing their reliance on credit bureaus.  This will bring more price transparency and savings for mortgage lenders, mortgage brokers and other industry participants, FICO said in a statement.  Shares of credit-reporting bureaus TransUnion and Equifax Inc. each fell more than 8% on Thursday.

headline: Why Equifax (EFX) Stock Is Falling Today
summary: Shares of credit reporting giant Equifax (NYSE:EFX) fell 8.1% in the morning session after Fair Isaac Corporation (FICO), a key business partner, announced a new program to license its mortgage credit scores directly to lenders, threatening to bypass the credit bureaus.

content.summary: Shares of credit reporting giant Equifax (NYSE:EFX) fell 8.1% in the morning session after Fair Isaac Corporation (FICO), a key business partner, announced a new program to license its mortgage credit scores directly to lenders, threatening to bypass the credit bureaus.

headline: Evaluating Equifax (EFX) Valuation Following Fair Isaac’s Direct FICO Access for Lenders
summary: Equifax (EFX) shares moved lower after Fair Isaac announced that mortgage lenders can now access FICO scores directly. This change cuts out Equifax and the other major credit bureaus from this critical part of the loan process. See our latest analysis for Equifax. Equifax’s recent slide comes as a fresh competitive threat clouds the outlook for credit bureaus, with the Fair Isaac announcement casting doubt on a key revenue stream. The bigger picture is that after a year marked by modest...

headline: Berkshire to acquire OxyChem for $9.7B, Fermi surges after IPO
summary: Morning Brief host Allie Canal tracks several of the day's top trending stock tickers, including Warren Buffett's Berkshire Hathaway (BRK-A, BRK-B) acquiring Occidental Petroleum's (OXY) petrochemical business — OxyChem — in a $9.7 billion deal, Fermi America (FRMI) stock surging after its IPO yesterday, and Equifax (EFX) and TransUnion (TRU) shares dropping on FICO's (FICO) new licensing program. Catch Yahoo Finance's full interview with Fermi America Co-Founder and CEO Toby Neugebauer after its IPO on Wednesday. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Morning Brief.

content.title: Berkshire to acquire OxyChem for $9.7B, Fermi surges after IPO

Catch Yahoo Finance's full interview with Fermi America Co-Founder and CEO Toby Neugebauer after its IPO on Wednesday.

To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Morning Brief.

headline: FICO Stock Leads S&P 500 On End-Run Around Equifax, Other Credit Bureaus
summary: Fair Isaac shares surged early Thursday after the company said it would make its predictive FICO credit scores directly available to the credit report vendors that play a key role in mortgage approvals.  The move to eliminate reliance on credit bureaus Equifax, Experian and TransUnion sent those shares plunging.  FICO was the top stock on the S&P 500 in early stock market action.

content.title: FICO Stock Leads S&P 500 On End-Run Around Equifax, Other Credit Bureaus
content.summary: Fair Isaac shares surged early Thursday after the company said it would make its predictive FICO credit scores directly available to the credit report vendors that play a key role in mortgage approvals.  The move to eliminate reliance on credit bureaus Equifax, Experian and TransUnion sent those shares plunging.  FICO was the top stock on the S&P 500 in early stock market action.

headline: Credit bureaus fall sharply as FICO launches direct-to-lender score program
summary: Investing.com -- Shares of major U.S. credit-reporting companies fell late Wednesday after Fair Isaac unveiled a new program that allows mortgage lenders to access FICO scores directly, sidestepping the three nationwide credit bureaus.

content.title: Credit bureaus fall sharply as FICO launches direct-to-lender score program
content.summary: Investing.com -- Shares of major U.S. credit-reporting companies fell late Wednesday after Fair Isaac unveiled a new program that allows mortgage lenders to access FICO scores directly, sidestepping the three nationwide credit bureaus.
